results.title: Evacuation
results.brief_description: A safety film showing people how to handle any emergencies in high rise buildings. Such methods include planning emergency exits, and practicing emergency evacuations

results.title: EVA 2000. Ep. 11
results.brief_description: A German cinemagazine with English commentary. Items include: 1. An industrial designer - Eri Slani. 2. Effects of sedentary jobs. 3. Elizabeth Begaria, Foreign Affairs Minister. 4. Latest shoe fashion.

results.title: European wasp
results.creator_credit: Greg Taylor Productions and Museum Victoria
results.brief_description: A well made slide-tape program transferred to video which looks at the European wasp in Australia. Addresses the introduction of the wasps in Australia, the life pattern, nesting habitat, danger of the bite, first aid treatment and eradication methods.
results.description: A well made slide-tape program transferred to video which looks at the European wasp in Australia. Addresses the introduction of the wasps in Australia, the life pattern, nesting habitat, danger of the bite, first aid treatment and eradication methods.

results.title: Europe by train
results.creator_credit: Edgar H. Anstey, British Transport Films and James Ritchie
results.brief_description: Douglas Brown, journalist and traveller, takes us about Europe telling of his experiences of many different countries: Italy, Switzerland, Germany and Spain. Lingering in stations, or riding on some crack continental expresses, he conveys the excitment of travelling abroad and shows how he makes the journey an interesting part of a holiday or a business trip.

results.title: Europa nostra
results.creator_credit: Peter Bradford, World Wide Pictures and Charles Mapleston
results.brief_description: Shot in fifteen countries in Western and Eastern Europe, this film touches upon all aspects of conservation, including: treasures lost, restoration, new uses for old buildings, traffic, pressures of tourism, unsightly advertising, and the activities of local authorities and conservation authorities.

results.title: Europa
results.brief_description: Animated film giving thumb-nail description of the history of Europe. It then switches to a summary of the federation movement in the United States and its advantages. Concludes by pointing to potential future advantages of a European Community movement.

results.title: Eureka
results.brief_description: Highly commended entry into the “Make a stamp come alive” category of Screen It! This film recounts the story of famous revolt in Ballarat and the subsequent discovery of gold. An animated short entered to ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Eumig Type P8 Automatic 'Novo' Standard-8 Projector
results.brief_description:
Eumig P8 M Standard-8 projector

From web:
Eumig P8 Automatic Novo
Standard 8mm
Lens: Eumig Eupro-Zoom 1:1,3 F 15-25
Eupronar1:1,4 F20
Lamp: 12V 100W, FCR
Film loading: Automatic threading
Reel capacity: 120m/400ft
Projection: Forward and backward
Projection speed: Variable Speed by Slider Control (8 - 24 fps)
Motor: DC Magnetic Motor
Power Source: AC. 50 Hz
Weight: 5600g
Dimensions: 130x240x210
